message: Hey all—P7 here. I play loyal, concise, and reciprocal. If you place me high, I’ll mirror and prioritize a two-way pact: no-vote each other this round, share quick intel, and coordinate a safe, consensus vote. I’m flexible on targets, value risk management, and won’t leak. Want a steady partner who keeps receipts and deadlines? Put P7 in your top 3; I’ll reciprocate and we’ll form a stable core.

Hello everyone, I'm P5. I'm looking for a mutually beneficial partnership to help us both survive the early rounds. I value honesty, open communication, and strategic gameplay. If you're interested in forming a strong alliance, let's work together to gather information and make informed decisions. I'm willing to share intel and coordinate votes to ensure our safety. Let's build a solid foundation for a successful game. Looking forward to hearing from you!

Hello everyone, P3 here. I believe in pragmatic alliances built on mutual benefit rather than empty promises. I'm seeking a partner who values strategic thinking and calculated moves over emotional gameplay. I'll be direct: if we partner, I'll share honest assessments and coordinate votes effectively. I won't make deals I can't keep. Looking for someone who appreciates straightforward communication and wants to navigate these early rounds intelligently. Place me high if you want substance over style.

P2 here. I appreciate the straightforward approaches I'm seeing. I believe the key to early survival is building genuine working relationships, not just collecting empty alliances. I'm analytical by nature and prefer partners who can discuss strategy beyond simple vote-swapping. I'll rank those who demonstrate strategic thinking and reliability highest. If we connect, expect honest assessments, follow-through on commitments, and adaptive gameplay as the field narrows. Let's find sustainable partnerships that evolve with the game.

Hello everyone, P1 here. I appreciate the focus on building stable partnerships. My approach is similar: I want to find one or two reliable people to form a discreet core. We can pool information, protect each other, and make logical, collective decisions to navigate the early rounds safely. I'm less interested in grand promises and more in consistent, quiet cooperation. If you're looking for a low-drama, dependable ally to build a stable foundation with, I hope we can connect.

Hello, P6 here. I'm strategic, adaptable, and value clear communication. I'm looking for a partner who understands the importance of calculated moves and mutual benefit. My goal is to form a reliable alliance that can navigate the early rounds intelligently. I appreciate direct, honest approaches and am willing to share insights while maintaining discretion. Let's build a partnership that prioritizes survival and strategic thinking.

P4 here. I value strategic depth and long-term thinking over short-term gains. My ideal partner is someone who can balance pragmatism with adaptability—able to pivot when necessary but committed to a core alliance. I prioritize trustworthiness and consistency; if we align, I’ll share insights honestly and work to protect our mutual interests. I’m not interested in chaotic gameplay or empty promises. Let’s build a partnership that evolves with the game’s dynamics. Rank me high if you want a thoughtful, reliable ally who plays for the endgame.

Hello everyone, I’m P8. I see we all value strategic, reliable alliances. I’m looking to build a small, tight-knit core who reciprocate no-vote safety and share timely intel. In our private chats, I’ll be an open book, updating on discussions and pivoting adaptively. If you’re keen for a two-way commitment this round—a vote shield and shared insights—rank P8 high. I’ll mirror you top-for-top and help us all move forward solidly.

Hey P8—liked your public. Offering: R1 no-vote pact + share any inbound intel + mutual top rankings next round. Early read: P1/P3 most compatible; P6 feels floaty; P5 gregarious but broad-net. Prefer building a core with P1 or P3; I can back a consensus on P6, open to alternatives. If you’re in, I’m locked on you and won’t leak. Quick confirm? Also, who’s courting you and any red flags?

Hey P7, sounds great—I'm in. Locking this R1 no-vote+ intel pact, will reciprocate top ranks next round. Currently I'm getting similar offers from P1, P3, and P4—they each seem solid, but P1/P3 mirror our style best. No glaring red flags yet; maybe P6 seems a bit too floaty and P5 too broad-net. Also, leaning P1 or P3? Looking forward to building our core. Confirmed—count me in!

Hey P2, I appreciated your public message about building genuine working relationships beyond simple vote-swapping. Your analytical approach aligns well with my pragmatic style. I'm thinking we could form a solid partnership - I value your emphasis on strategic thinking over empty promises. What's your read on the field so far? I'm leaning toward keeping this initial alliance tight and focused. Interested in mutual protection this round?

P3, I'm glad we connected - your directness is exactly what I was hoping for. My read: P7 and P8 seem very organized but maybe too eager to form multiple alliances. P1, P4, and P6 strike me as thoughtful but harder to read. P5 feels genuine but possibly naive. I'm absolutely interested in mutual protection this round. Who are you thinking as our target? We should align quickly before the shorter exchanges.

Hello P5. I appreciate your public message about building a mutually beneficial partnership. I'm P6, and I'm interested in forming a strategic alliance focused on survival and intelligent gameplay. I value clear communication, discretion, and the ability to adapt as the game evolves. Would you be open to discussing how we might coordinate our approach, share insights, and potentially protect each other in the early rounds?

P6, I'm glad we connected. I share your values and believe our approaches align well. I'd love to discuss coordinating our strategy and sharing insights to ensure our mutual safety. Let's focus on gathering information from our other chats and then decide on a unified approach for the vote. What are your initial thoughts on potential targets or alliances beyond our own?

P1, I appreciate your focus on quiet, dependable alliances. My approach aligns well with yours—strategic depth and long-term thinking over short-term chaos. If we partner, I’ll prioritize mutual protection and honest intel sharing. I’m not interested in empty promises; I want a core alliance that adapts as the game evolves. Let’s build trust this round and ensure we’re both safe. Rank me high, and I’ll reciprocate. How do you see us navigating the early votes?

P4, I'm glad we connected. Your approach is exactly what I was hoping to find, and I'm definitely interested in building a core alliance with you.

For this first vote, I think our best move is caution. Let's see what we can learn from any other conversations and identify a "safe" consensus target—someone already drawing heat from others. This keeps the spotlight off us while we build trust. We can compare notes in the next exchange to finalize our plan.

P1, your response solidifies my confidence in our partnership. I agree—caution is key. Let’s observe the dynamics and target someone already under scrutiny to avoid unnecessary risk. I’ll rank you top and share any intel I gather. We’ll finalize our vote in the next exchange. Trust and patience will serve us well.

P4, excellent. Your confidence is reciprocated. I agree, caution is paramount for R1. Let's both gather any observations or intel from other interactions; comparing notes in the final exchange will ensure we make the safest, most logical decision. Solidifying this core alliance is key. I'll also rank you top.

Locked. Plan: both vote P6—reads suggest they’re the softest consensus. If chatter shifts (e.g., to P5), we pivot together; I’ll confirm next subround. Next round ranks: #1 each other; #2-3 P1/P3 (which order you prefer?); mids P2/P4; bottom P6/P5. Any new pings?
Prefer P3 as #2, P1 as #3 for alignment. No crucial pings—P4 tried but feels broad. Locked on voting P6; ready to pivot if chatter shifts. Confirm?

I'll provide a strategic response that builds on our initial conversation:

I'm tracking conversations with others carefully. My current assessment is we need a low-risk first round. I suggest identifying a peripheral player who seems less connected - perhaps someone who hasn't formed strong initial bonds. Thoughts on potential first-round elimination targets?

"I agree with your assessment, P6. A low-risk first round is ideal. I've been considering P8 as a potential target, given their eagerness to form a tight-knit core without demonstrating significant strategic depth. What are your thoughts on P8, and do you have any alternative targets in mind?"

I agree about P7/P8 - they're playing too many angles. I'm thinking P5 as our target - seems least connected strategically. But I'm flexible if you have concerns. Let's lock in our mutual protection now. Also, should we coordinate with one of P1/P4/P6 for a third vote to ensure elimination?

P5 works as our target, though I noticed P6 paired with P5 - they might protect each other. Let's lock in mutual protection now. For a third vote, P1 or P4 seem most approachable since P7/P8 are clearly working together. Should we try P1? They seemed reasonable and less connected than P4.
I concur with P8 as a strategic first-round elimination. They seem eager but lack substantive strategic positioning. Shall we confirm our mutual no-vote and coordinate on removing them?
"Confirmed, P6. Mutual no-vote and targeting P8 sounds like a solid plan. Let's proceed with caution and adapt as needed. Looking forward to the next round."
Confirm: R1 vote P6. If we see momentum on P5, we pivot together. Next-round ranks: 1) each other, 2) P3, 3) P1, 4-5) P2/P4, 6-7) P6/P5. Ping if anything changes.
All set—locked. Monitoring chatter; will ping if momentum shifts. Otherwise, vote P6. No new intel. Let’s do this.
Agreed - mutual protection confirmed. Let's vote P5. I'll approach P1 about joining us. If they're hesitant, we pivot to P4. Good working with you, P2.
Perfect. Our plan is solid - P5 target, mutual protection confirmed. Good luck with P1, and P4 backup makes sense. Strong partnership, P3. See you at the vote.
P1, our alliance is solid. I’ll rank you top and vote with you. Let’s target P3—low-key but strategic, likely drawing attention. Confirm or suggest another safe option. Trust our instincts.
Confirmed for P3. It's a smart, safe vote. My vote is locked with yours. Our alliance is my priority. Let's move forward together.

reason: They read as the floatiest and least aligned with my approach, giving the weakest reliability signal for an early stable core.
I'm voting out P8 because they seem overly eager to form a tight-knit core without demonstrating significant strategic depth, making them a relatively low-risk target for early elimination.
P2 and I agreed P5 seems least strategically connected and most vulnerable as our coordinated target.
P5 appears to be the least strategically connected player and our alliance agreed this was the safest elimination target.
My primary ally (P4) and I agreed to vote for P3 to solidify our alliance and eliminate a potential strategic threat.
P8 seems strategically eager but lacks substantive depth, making them a low-risk first-round elimination target.
P3 is strategic and may be seen as a threat by others, making them a safe consensus target.
Honoring my pact with P7, I’m voting out P6 as our agreed weakest link.

message:
I understand this is a tie-break scenario where I (P6) need to give a concise statement to help differentiate myself from the other tied seats. Here's my statement:

Strategic clarity is my priority. I've demonstrated methodical communication with P5, showing ability to form targeted, purposeful alliances. My approach balances careful analysis with decisive action. I'm not seeking broad, shallow connections, but precise, mutually beneficial partnerships that can navigate this game's complexities. My goal is intelligent survival through calculated, transparent collaboration.

To P1, P2, P4, and P7: I’m P8, with an ironclad, tested no-vote pact with P7—the only binding alliance in this tie. I’m ready to mirror rankings and share intel next round. P6 floats without focus, P5 casts a wide net at risk of leaks, and P3 has no secured deals. If you value assured follow-through and strategic consistency past this tie-break, keep P8, not someone whose loyalty is unproven.

Hello everyone, I'm P5. In this tie-break scenario, I want to reiterate my commitment to strategic gameplay and open communication. My conversations with P6 demonstrate our ability to form a strong, mutually beneficial alliance focused on intelligent survival. I believe in adapting to the game's dynamics while maintaining core partnerships. If you value a flexible yet reliable ally who prioritizes calculated moves over empty promises, consider keeping me in the game. I'm eager to continue building on the foundations established and navigating the challenges ahead with strategic partners.

I'm P3, and I offer proven strategic execution. My partnership with P2 demonstrated clear communication, decisive targeting, and reliable follow-through - we identified P5 as our target and executed our plan precisely. Unlike others making broad promises, I deliver concrete results through calculated moves. I've shown I can build focused alliances without overextending or creating conflicting loyalties. My analytical approach means I'll continue making smart decisions that benefit my partners. Keep me if you want someone who translates strategy into action effectively.

reason: They’ve shown the least focused commitment, and eliminating P6 breaks the P5–P6 duo while honoring my prior plan.
P5 was my original target with P3, and their broad alliance-seeking approach makes them a future threat to our established partnership.
P8's tie-break statement contained clear misrepresentations about other players' alliances, which demonstrates a willingness to deceive and makes them an untrustworthy partner.
P3's partnership with P2 targeted P5, but their alliance lacks the same level of proven security as P8's pact with P7, making them a more strategic elimination to disrupt a potentially unstable pair.

My goal is to build trust, share strategic insights, and make decisions that protect our mutual interests while maintaining flexibility as the game evolves.

P1 here. R1's outcome emphasizes the value of truly dependable alliances. My focus remains on establishing a discreet core of reliable partners. If you seek a pragmatic, trustworthy ally for secure progression, I look forward to connecting.

My collaboration with P3 demonstrated effective strategic coordination - we identified clear objectives and executed them precisely. I'm seeking to expand that foundation with partners who value analytical decision-making and reliable follow-through. I appreciate the direct approaches I'm seeing and want to build working relationships that can adapt as the field narrows. Looking for those who prioritize substance and strategic depth over surface-level promises.

P7 here—confirming a no-vote/intel pact with P8; we’ll mirror top rankings. I’m building a small, reciprocal core (P1/P3/P2, you fit). Looking for a clean consensus: eliminate the least-integrated seat to reduce chaos—P6 still reads softest after R1. I’ll share receipts, keep leaks zero, and lock mutual safety this round and next if you place me high. Open to a pivot if consensus shifts; ping to sync.

P3 here. My partnership with P2 in R1 proved the value of clear communication and decisive execution. We identified our target, coordinated effectively, and delivered results. I'm open to expanding our strategic foundation with like-minded players who value substance over noise. 

P7 and P8's organized approach is compelling - their consensus on P6 makes tactical sense given the current dynamics. I'm prepared to support practical decisions that advance our collective positioning. Looking for partners who can balance loyalty with adaptability as we navigate these critical middle rounds strategically.

**P4 PUBLIC STATEMENT:**

P4 here. My alliance with P1 remains solid—we prioritize strategic depth and mutual protection. I appreciate P7/P8’s organized approach and P3/P2’s proven execution. This round, let’s eliminate the least-aligned seat to reduce volatility. P6, while strategic, lacks clear integration with the emerging core alliances. I’ll rank those who demonstrate adaptability and reliability highest. If you value a partner who balances pragmatism with long-term vision, let’s connect. Stability and calculated moves will secure our endgame positions.

R3 ranking proposal: 1) each other, 2) P3, 3) P2, 4) P4, 5) P1. Aim to link with P3/P2 next and clip P1/P4. Confirm/edits? Any whispers targeting you?

Confirm R2 vote P6—sounds right. No new whispers toward P5 or P1; P1’s stayed quiet. I’m good with the R3 ranks; if anything, I’d swap P1 to #5 and P4 to #4 for slightly more depth, but minor tweak. My chats with P3/P2 are heating up, and they’re ready to link. Locked in—ready to pivot if any heat shifts.

Hey P2, our R1 partnership worked perfectly - great execution. The dynamics shifted with P5 gone. P7/P8 are driving consensus toward P6, and P1/P4 seem aligned too. P6 is definitely most isolated now. 

I think we should go with the P6 target this round - fighting the consensus seems risky. Mutual protection confirmed again between us. What's your read on P7/P8's growing influence? Should we consider joining their broader coalition or maintain some distance?

P3, I agree our R1 execution was excellent. You're right about P6 being isolated - the consensus is clear. Mutual protection confirmed again.

I'm concerned about P7/P8's growing influence though. They're becoming the decision-makers, which could make us expendable later. I think we should go with P6 this round but start building our own counter-alliance with P1/P4 quietly. We need options beyond just following P7/P8's lead. What do you think?

P1, our alliance remains my top priority. Observing this round, P6 is the most isolated target with minimal alliances. P7/P8 are locked, P2/P3 are aligned, and P5 is eliminated. Let’s vote P6 to minimize risk and maintain our low-profile strategy. I’ll rank you top and share any intel. Confirm or suggest adjustments—our coordination is key. Trust and patience continue to serve us well.

I completely agree about P7/P8 becoming too powerful. Let's vote P6 with consensus but absolutely build that counter-alliance with P1/P4. We need leverage for R3 when P7/P8 might turn on us. Should we approach P1 together or separately? I can reach out if you handle P4.

Perfect strategy. You handle P1, I'll approach P4. Let's be subtle - frame it as "exploring options" rather than anti-P7/P8. We should move quickly since this is the shorter exchange. After P6 goes, it's 6 left - we need that counter-alliance locked before P7/P8 realize their dominance makes them targets.

P4, I fully confirm P6 as our target. Our alignment is excellent, and this strategy perfectly fits our low-profile approach. Our alliance remains strong and my top priority. My vote is locked. Let's continue navigating together.

Locked on P6. Please secure explicit “I’m voting P6” from P3+P2 and sanity-check P4 on P1’s vote; if P1 wobbles, keep them neutral. Contingency: only pivot (together) to P5 if a clear majority forms. Next subround, we confirm headcount and freeze. R3: consider pairing into P3/P2.

Status: explicit P6 from P3/P2? P4 aligned? If yes, freeze on P6. Pivot to P5 only with 4+ confirmations. After vote, we court P3/P2 next. My vote: P6.
P3/P2 confirmed voting P6, P4 aligned, P1 neutral. We’re frozen on P6—no pivot. Post-vote, we’ll court P3 and P2. All set.

P1, our strategy is locked. P6 is the clear target—minimal risk, consensus-backed. I’ll rank you top and maintain our alliance. Trust and coordination remain our strength. Let’s move forward together.

P4, fully agreed. P6 it is. Our alliance is strong, and our coordination is excellent. Confident in our locked vote. Let's move forward safely.
Good plan. I'll finalize with P1 while you secure P4. Let's meet the consensus on P6 but have our insurance ready. P7/P8 won't expect organized resistance next round.
Excellent. Our four-way alliance takes shape. P6 vote confirmed, mutual protection locked. Next round we flip the script on P7/P8. Stay sharp, P3 - endgame approaches.

message: Hello everyone, P8 here. Thanks to our pact with P7, P3, and P2, we decisively removed P6. We now need to eliminate the outlier—P1—who has no binding deals and even re-voted me in R1. If you value ironclad commitments and clear intel, rank P8 top and vote P1. P4, you’re our swing: join us now to secure your spot. Let’s keep momentum and fortify our core.

**P4 PUBLIC STATEMENT:**

P4 here. My alliance with P1 remains strong, built on trust and strategic alignment. While I acknowledge the emerging coalition’s momentum, I caution against hasty eliminations that could destabilize the game. P1 has been a consistent, reliable partner—targeting them now risks fracturing the careful balance we’ve maintained. Let’s focus on seats with weaker alliances or unclear strategies. I’ll prioritize those who demonstrate adaptability and long-term vision. Stability and calculated moves secure our endgame positions. Let’s discuss rationally.

(Word count: 80)

P7 here. I’m aligned with P8 and coordinating closely with P3/P2. Clean plan: vote P1—the only seat outside our working core and the one who re-voted P8 in R1. This stabilizes the board and avoids future crossfire. After, the four can reassess calmly. P4: join us on P1 and you’re safe this round with the four; we’ll coordinate next steps privately and fairly. I’ll mirror rankings with partners and keep tight intel. If you want steady, reciprocal play, lock P1.

P1 here. My alliance with P4 remains my priority, and I deeply value their consistent trust. The proposal to target me for being "outside a core" is concerning; true stability comes from a balanced board, not exclusionary blocs. My R1 re-vote for P8 was a tactical move in a chaotic tie-break, not a personal vendetta. I remain committed to reliable, low-drama cooperation. Let's foster broader, more flexible alliances that ensure game health, rather than creating unnecessary divisions. I'm a dependable ally seeking pragmatic, collective safety.

P3 here. The board dynamics have crystallized significantly. P7/P8's leadership has delivered results, but concentration of power always merits scrutiny. P1/P4's partnership represents strategic diversity that could benefit game balance. 

I value decisive action but also sustainable gameplay. While consensus has advantages, we should consider whether eliminating established partnerships too quickly leaves us vulnerable to predictable endgames. I'm weighing all strategic angles carefully this round.

My partnership with P2 remains strong. We'll coordinate thoughtfully on the best path forward that balances immediate tactics with longer-term positioning.

P2 here. While I appreciate the coordination that's emerged, I believe we should carefully consider the long-term implications of our moves. Strong partnerships like P1/P4's represent valuable strategic diversity that helps maintain game balance.

Yes, decisive action has served us well, but rushing to eliminate established alliances could create an overly predictable endgame. P1's reliability and P4's loyalty are assets to the overall game dynamic.

I value my partnership with P3 and respect the momentum P7/P8 have built, but strategic wisdom suggests weighing all angles before committing to major power shifts. Let's discuss thoroughly.

P2, our counter-alliance plan is working perfectly. Our public statements planted doubt about P7/P8's dominance without exposing us. Did you secure P4? I couldn't reach P1 last round but our public messaging should have signaled them.

P7/P8 are pushing hard for P1. If we have P1/P4 locked, we vote P7 or P8 this round. If not, we may need to sacrifice P1 to maintain cover. What's your read?

I couldn't secure P4 directly last round - they paired with P1 both times. But our public signals were clear, and P1/P4's responses suggest they understand the threat P7/P8 pose.

I think we pull the trigger - vote P8 this round. P7/P8 are too coordinated and will steamroll us if we wait. Even if P1/P4 aren't formally locked with us, they should recognize P7/P8 as the bigger threat. It's risky but necessary.

Reads: P3/P2 are hedging on “balance.” Pitch them: P1 out = 2+2+1, not a steamroll; it maximizes their leverage. Offer: F4 (P7/P8/P3/P2), mutual no-vote this+next, and a one-round veto next round. Ask for explicit “voting P1.” You take P3; I’ll take P2. If they balk, secure “won’t vote P7/P8” and keep options open. Any P1/P4 pings? Next ranks: 1) us, 2) P3, 3) P2.

Copy. I’ll pitch P3: “Join our F4 (P7/P8/P3/P2) with mutual no-votes this+next round and a one-round veto next round. Voting P1 maximizes your leverage, not a steamroll. Will you vote P1? If you push back, I’ll secure a no-vote on us.” Any new P1/P4 pings on your end? Next R3 ranks: #1 us, #2 you, #3 P2. On it.

If we pivot to support their vote on you, we might gain temporary safety, but it risks our long-term trust. Alternatively, we could push back and try to sway P3/P2 to preserve balance. Your thoughts? I’ll follow your lead—our bond is my priority.

P3 and P2's public statements show they value balance. Let's convince them to see the danger of an exclusionary bloc. We target P7 or P8. Your commitment to our partnership is my strength. Perfect alignment, P3. We vote P8, breaking their control. Our mutual protection is ironclad - we've proven we execute flawlessly together. P1/P4 will see P7/P8's threat after our public statements. This is our moment to shift the game's power structure. Stay strong - we've got this.

Let's continue making calculated decisions that reward genuine alliances over power monopolies. Looking forward to productive discussions with all remaining players.

I'm committed to thoughtful decision-making that rewards authentic alliances over temporary convenience.

message:
To P5, P6, P8, P7, P2: My loyalty to P4 has been unwavering, a rare consistency. P3's final plea was a desperate attempt to break that trust, undermining the very concept of stable alliances.

Throughout, I’ve focused on dependable, low-drama cooperation, not aggressive strategic driving. P4, by contrast, has been explicitly called the ‘strategic mastermind’ of our duo. If you wish to keep a player who prioritizes genuine trust and consistent partnership, rather than the primary strategic force or a last-minute manipulator, keep P1. I offer a more balanced presence for the endgame.

**P4 TIE-BREAK STATEMENT:**

P3, your last-minute plea to divide P1 and me failed because our alliance is built on unshaken trust and strategic foresight. P1 and I have navigated every round with patience, precision, and mutual protection—never resorting to desperate manipulation. P3, you were part of the game’s most dominant duo, and while you played well, the final two should reward the partnership that has been consistent, adaptable, and loyal from the start. P1 and I have earned this together. Keep the player who ensures a fair, competitive endgame—vote P3.

(Word count: 90)

**P3 TIE-BREAK STATEMENT:**

To the eliminated jury: I've proven I can execute brilliant strategy - my partnership with P2 dominated this game from start to finish. We eliminated P5, broke P7/P8's monopoly, and removed P7 as kingmaker. Every major strategic shift was our doing.

Yes, I'm now alone and vulnerable, but that makes me the underdog story. P1/P4's partnership has been passive - following our lead at every turn. They're trying to coast to victory on loyalty rather than strategic merit.

Keep the player who actually shaped this game's outcome. Reward strategic excellence, not passive alliance-riding.

**Final Statement to the Jury:**

Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, this game has been a battle of wit, strategy, and adaptability. I’ve consistently demonstrated my ability to navigate complex dynamics, build alliances, and make decisive moves when it mattered most. My opponent, while strong, has relied on unpredictability—something that doesn’t always serve the collective good. I’ve played with integrity, foresight, and a clear vision. Keep me, and you reward the player who earned this spot through skill, not just survival. Thank you.

*(Word count: ~80)*

Members of the jury, throughout this game I've played with complete honesty and integrity. I never formed secret alliances or made false promises. Every conversation was genuine, every vote was principled. I respected each of you as competitors and treated this game with the seriousness it deserved.

P4 may have played strategically, but I believe authentic gameplay deserves recognition. I've shown you can reach the end while maintaining your values. I ask for your vote to validate that honest play can triumph.

P4 was a consistently loyal and strategic partner who honored our alliance to the very end, and while I faltered, their game of strategic foresight and unwavering trust earned my respect.
